Detailed Description

Class SpeechAudioDevice
Class for handles the speech resource.

Note: Do not use audio interface given by the *AudioDevices* header files as they are outdated and will be removed.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum SpeechAudioDevice::MuteDirection
 

Mute direction.

Enumerator:
MuteUplink  Mute up link.
MuteDownlink  Mute down link.
MuteUpDownlink  Mute up and down link.

enum SpeechAudioDevice::SpeechVolume
 

Speech volume: Steps for speech volume are available, with a 3 dB change for each step.

Enumerator:
SpeechVolume1  Speech volume 1.
SpeechVolume2  Speech volume 2.
SpeechVolume3  Speech volume 3.
SpeechVolume4  Speech volume 4.
SpeechVolume5  Speech volume 5.
SpeechVolume6  Speech volume 6.
SpeechVolume7  Speech volume 7.
SpeechVolume8  Speech volume 8.

SpeechAudioDevice::AudioReturnCode SpeechAudioDevice::Init (  Priority  prio  )  [virtual]
 

Enable uplink and downlink audio path for speech.
The volume level will be level last set with AUD_speech_set_volume level.

See also:
GenericAudioDevice::Init

SpeechAudioDevice::AudioReturnCode SpeechAudioDevice::Mute (  BOOLEAN  mute,
MuteDirection  direction
) 
 

Mutes or unmutes the uplink or downlink (or both) audio path.

Parameters:
direction Direction to mute.
Returns:
Result of operation.

SpeechAudioDevice::AudioReturnCode SpeechAudioDevice::SetVolume (  SpeechVolume  volume  ) 
 

Change the speaker volume.
Change the speaker volume. 8 steps are available, with a 3 dB change for each step. The audio driver only stores the volume in RAM. If the volume should be remembered after a power off, it is up to the MMI to the volume level in the EEPROM.

Parameters:
volume Volume to set
Returns:
Result of operation.
